reviews.review_msg: Didn't realize it before since it was in my clueless first year but after finishing his course, it was quite good. I got a lot of information from it and also really enjoyed the analysis from his chosen novels. Love his lectures, very concise and insightful. Wish he was back at SFU would love to take another WL course with him again.

Greg is a wonderful professor and person in general. If you have a chance to take a course with him DO IT. He is funny, engaging, and highly inspiring. An all around cool guy. He's the reason I majored in World Lit

He's an amazing teacher.  He's knowledgeable, involved, hilarious, and treats every single student with respect and gives them positive feedback for offering opinions in class.  The material was excellent, I learned so much; but at the same time failed another course because of the workload for this one. There was so much to do! Not an easy course

Greg is probably one of the best profs/teachers I've ever had.  I learnt alot about literature and it's relevance to the outside world as well as myself. I hope that he comes back to do more World Lit courses at SFU.
